parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The ID of the GTM instance for which you want to create an address pool.

parameters.name: Interval
parameters.description: The health check interval. Unit: seconds. Set the value to 60.

parameters.name: Lang
parameters.description: The language of the values of specific response parameters.

parameters.name: MinAvailableAddrNum
parameters.description: The minimum number of available addresses in the address pool.

parameters.name: MonitorExtendInfo
parameters.description:
The extended information. The required parameters vary based on the value of ProtocolType.

When ProtocolType is set to HTTP or HTTPS:

*   port: the port that you want to check
*   failureRate: the failure rate
*   code: the return code. The health check result is deemed abnormal if the returned value is greater than the specified value. Valid values: 400 and 500.
*   host: the host settings
*   path: the URL path

When ProtocolType is set to PING:

*   packetNum: the number of ping packets
*   packetLossRate: the packet loss rate
*   failureRate: the failure rate

When ProtocolType is set to TCP:

*   port: the port that you want to check
*   failureRate: the failure rate

parameters.name: MonitorStatus
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to enable the health check. Valid values:

*   **OPEN**: enables the health check.
*   **CLOSE**: disables the health check. This is the default value.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name of the address pool.

parameters.name: ProtocolType
parameters.description:
The health check protocol. Valid values:

*   HTTP
*   HTTPS
*   Ping
*   TCP

parameters.name: Timeout
parameters.description: The timeout period. Unit: milliseconds. Valid values: 2000, 3000, 5000, and 10000.

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description:
The type of the address pool. Valid values:

*   **IP**: IPv4 address
*   **DOMAIN**: domain name
